something such as a piece of equipment or a decoration that is not necessary, but that makes a machine, car, room etc more useful or more attractive
bathroom accessories such as mirrors and towel-rails
something such as a bag, belt, or jewellery that you wear or carry because it is attractive
a set of fully matching clothes and accessories
someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
an accessory before/after the fact (=someone who helps a criminal before or after the crime)
something that you add to a machine, tool, car etc so that it can do other things or in order to make it look attractive
They sell software and computer accessories.
a manufacturer of motor vehicle parts and accessories
small things that are used for a particular activity
a retail chain that sells cooking items, kitchen accessories and home furnishings
a maker of plastic folders, binders and other office accessories
someone who helps a criminal, but is not directly involved in a crime
He was an accessory to murder.
